attributes.action: Consider funding half the cost of weight loss surgery
attributes.additional_details:
In the UK, approximately 65% of the adult population are considered overweight or obese. Even more shockingly, approximately 20% of children are considered obese. 

Obesity related illness or disease currently costs the NHS approximately £6.5 billion.

A person who has various co-morbidities such as diabetes, high blood pressure and heart disease could rack up a cost hundreds of thousands for the NHS, whereas accessing bariatric surgery sooner could help - approx cost of the surgery? £12,000.
attributes.background: I’d like the government to consider funding half of the cost of bariatric surgery for those it is deemed medically necessary; enabling access to bariatric surgery sooner would save the NHS millions of pounds in the long run, and help people take control of their weight and health earlier.

rejection.details:
Weight loss surgery is already available through the NHS: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/weight-loss-surgery/

Decisions about whether a patient qualifies for NHS weight loss surgery are matter for individual clinicians, not the Government or Parliament.
